meanings.definition: The condition of being considered more important than someone or something else.
meanings.sent1: In our class, the teacher always gives precedence to students who raise their hands.
meanings.sent2: The CEO's opinion takes precedence in important company decisions.
meanings.sent3: At the pizza party, the pepperoni slices seemed to have precedence over the cheese ones.
meanings.sent4: During emergencies, safety takes precedence over everything else.
meanings.sent5: The safety of the passengers should always be given precedence over other concerns.

meanings.definition: The right to take precedence over others in a particular situation.
meanings.sent1: As the team captain, Sarah had precedence in choosing the team's strategy.
meanings.sent2: The senior citizens were granted precedence in boarding the bus.
meanings.sent3: The birthday girl had precedence in picking the first game to play.
meanings.sent4: The king's decree gave him precedence over all other nobles.
meanings.sent5: The winner of the race earned the precedence to lead the victory parade.

meanings.definition: The order to be followed in a sequence or series.
meanings.sent1: In baking, the recipe's steps must be followed in precedence to achieve the perfect cake.
meanings.sent2: The traffic lights dictate the precedence of vehicles at the intersection.
meanings.sent3: The alphabet song helps children learn the precedence of letters in the alphabet.
meanings.sent4: The rules of the game outline the precedence of moves players can make.
meanings.sent5: Understanding the precedence of historical events helps make sense of timelines.
